intro: Thymus × monrealensis nothosubsp. conquensis, commonly known as the Monreal thyme, is a hybrid plant belonging to the Lamiaceae family. It is characterized by its compact growth habit and aromatic, small, grey-green leaves. The plant produces pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. This subspecies is valued for its ornamental appeal and use in culinary and medicinal applications.
